                                                                    Hex-Dump Conversion
Talking Points on FLSA



People who leave welfare for work should be treated like any other worker:

·      If they are workers, not trainees, they should receive the minimum wage, overtime, and
       unemployment insurance.

·      Their employers must adhere to the Occupational and Safety Act and anti-discrimination
       laws.

Not all welfare to work activities will be considered "work" under the Fair Labor Standards Act.
But those that are work should be treated like work. That's not just our view -- it is the law.
